pull.title: qt: Do not block GUI thread in RPCConsole
pull.body:
On master (35eda631ed3bd23d4a41761a85a96f925d4a6337) the GUI thread is blocked with [`QThread::wait()`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qthread.html#wait) during `bitcoin-qt` shutdown routine. This causes unresponsive GUI if some commands are passed to the RPC console (#13217) before shutdown initiating.

This PR:
- removes blocking call and uses additional signal-to-slot connections.
- makes `bitcoin-qt` shutdown routine more streamlined: the only [`QApplication::exec()`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qapplication.html#exec) is used in `bitcoin-qt`. Therefore, the main event loop never interrupts until shutdown, unlike master and alternative #13674.

Refs:
- #10504
- #17145 

This PR is an alternative to #13674.

Fix #13217

events.body:
> Fix #13217; this is an alternative to #13674
> Fix #17495
> 
> As a side effect, this PR makes `bitcoin-qt` shutdown routine more streamlined.
> 
> Refs:
> 
> * #10504
> * #17145

Could you update this with a description of what this PR does? Useful information to include: 

- details about how behavior changed, what behavior was before and after this change
- a short description of the code changes, what was wrong with the old code, and how the commits relate to each other
- how this compares to the alternative pr

It's great to link to other issues and pull requests in a PR description for extra details, but it shouldn't be necessary to open multiple other issues just to have a basic understanding of what a PR does and what motivated it

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
Calling `waitfornewblock` in the GUI console returns immediately.

> Calling `waitfornewblock` in the GUI console returns immediately.

I have observed such behavior on `regtest` only once, and cannot reproduce anymore.

Could you provide steps to reproduce an issue reliably?
@hebasto actually it's unrelated to this change. Just noticed that `waitfornewblock` returns immediately in the GUI console because `IsRPCRunning` is false unless you start with `-server`.

The folllowing still hangs:
 - `bitcoin-qt -regtest -server`
 - open gui console
 - run `waitfornewblock`
 - try to quit

Are you able to reproduce?

@promag 

> The folllowing still hangs:
> 
>     * `bitcoin-qt -regtest -server`
> 
>     * open gui console
> 
>     * run `waitfornewblock`
> 
>     * try to quit

This requires a forced interruption of the RPC thread. It seems a bit out of the scope of this PR, as it solves the blocking of the GUI thread only.

In your example `bitcoin-qt` literally "waits for new block", which is unreachable in `regtest` after quit is initiated  ;)
But this PR works on `mainnet` and `testnet`: `bitcoin-qt` quits just after a new block arrives.

Maybe, to mention in OP that #17495 is fixed, is wrong, no?
@hebasto maybe just mention it's not a complete fix.

@promag 
> @hebasto maybe just mention it's not a complete fix.

The mention about the fix of #17495 has been removed from PR description.

The actual fix of #17495 is #18452 ;)

Rebased 485e3dea08d291f1b32ba94e09ee793440f4daec -> e7ee445b9191d37505c8711115c5ef85c86ba31f ([pr17659.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17659.01) -> [pr17659.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17659.02)) due to the conflict with #16224.

Rebased e7ee445b9191d37505c8711115c5ef85c86ba31f -> 776d15763ea1551d7a5a86be29cfcd125d173d9d ([pr17659.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17659.02) -> [pr17659.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17659.03)) due to the conflict with #16432.

events.body: Rebased 776d15763ea1551d7a5a86be29cfcd125d173d9d -> 47912c505eebc79c849cf14fcf9d2654caa0945a ([pr17659.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17659.03) -> [pr17659.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17659.04)) due to the conflict with #19011.
Lets move this over to the [GUI repo](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui). I've also ported the original issue there now as well, given that the non-gui part has been fixed.
